title.narrative: Agro-Ecological Management of Productive Systems in the Small Farming Community of Marmas, Montero-Ayabaca

description.narrative: The project will work with the small farming community of Marmas, which sits high in the Andean Mountains in the districts of Montero y Jililí, Ayabaca, in the Piura region. Here families live in poverty and suffer with food insecurity, deterioration of their natural resources and the weakening of their use of Andean farm technology and practices that are based on the astronomical agricultural calendar. Recently, they implemented the use of agrochemicals that degrade the land, reduce productivity and harm the environment. The project seeks to improve food security, family income and safeguard the community’s natural resources through agro-ecological management of production systems, strengthening community organization and promoting food sovereignty in coordination with local governments. The project will assist 550 families —200 original and 350 from passing on the gift — by providing 300 pigs, 450 guinea pigs, seeds and improved stoves. It will promote production and consumption of healthy food, and provide technical assistance and training in production, leadership, organizational strengthening and action for social change in the farm families’ lives. Ultimately, the project will enable them to participate actively in consensus building and decision-making at the local and regional levels.
